content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to Catharine Nance, 21 July 18521 This morning I received an affidavit of yours, inclosed with a letter ofL. B. Wynne, for the purpose of getting a Patent from the Land Office–2Herewith is the Patent,– Please accept my respects–3
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Catharine Nance, 21 July 18521 This morning I received an affidavit of yours, inclosed with a letter ofL. B. Wynne, for the purpose of getting a Patent from the Land Office–2Herewith is the Patent,– Please accept my respects–3

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter, including the address on the second
                  sheet, which was folded to form an envelope.
2The affidavit and Lewis B. Wynne’s letter have not been located.
3The patent was not enclosed in this letter, and its whereabouts is unknown.

structured_content.text: Abraham Lincoln to Catharine Nance, 21 July 18521
This morning I received an affidavit of yours, inclosed with a letter ofL. B. Wynne, for the purpose of getting a Patent from the Land Office–2Herewith is the Patent,–  Please accept my respects–3
